Bishop and Doctor of the Church 1 Sm 24321 Mk 31319 Sat Jan 25 Conversion of St Paul Apostle Acts 22316 or Acts 9122 Mk 161518 Sun Jan 26 Third Sunday in Ordinary Time Is 82393 Mt 41223 SECOND SUNDAY IN ORDINARY TIME January 19 2020 Following the Baptism of the Lord this weekend brings the Church into the Second Sunday of Ordinary Time Though this season is the longest in the entire Church year running for 34 weeks throughout the year we will only be in it briefly at this time until the beginning of Lent on Ash Wednesday February 26th At this time we are called to put into practice that great gift which we have received and experienced throughout the Christmas season This gift of Christmas is of course Jesus Christ For this reason and to remove all doubt we hear from the Gospel of St John today as we enter into this new season And as we have heard St John the Baptist clearly testifies that Jesus is the Son of God John 134 After this proclamation from the Gospel of St John we will return to the Gospel of St Matthew with a brief interlude from the Gospel of St Luke on the Feast of the Presentation St Matthew writing towards a JewishChristian audience will focus his Gospel on Jesus as the King of Israel and what it means to truly be a disciple of the Lord Respect Life This past Friday we had an opportunity to screen 2019s critically acclaimed film Unplanned This lifechanging film followed the journey of Abby Johnson the youngest clinic director in the history of Planned Parenthood as she resigned her position from the abortion clinic and joined the Coalition for Life a prayerbased prolife ministry This past Saturday many parishioners travelled to Fort Wayne to participate in the Allen County March for Life This yearly march gathers thousands from the Fort Waynearea to serve as a witness to and support for the dignity of all hu man life from conception to natural death These events lead us into a day of prayer and fasting this coming Wednesday January 22nd January 22nd will mark the 47th anniversary of both Roe vs Wade and the lesser known Doe vs Bolton These two Supreme Court decisions called abortion a constitutional right and removed many of the factors limiting abortions throughout our country Since that time over 66 million children have lost their lives through abortion in our country alone On this day we are urged to work and pray for an end to the evil that is abortion in our country and throughout the world We are also called to pray for all those who find themselves in a situation that would lead them to consider an abortion All human persons from conception to natural death have an inherent dignity and an inalienable right to life Though prolife issues garner a special focus in our minds this week as this sorrowful anniversary approaches they are issues that should guide us each and everyday of our lives The respect of human life and the building up of the culture of life occurs in the everyday moments that we face when we are facetoface with family neighbor friend and stranger It starts first and foremost right at home in our families In his encyclical The Gospel of Life Evangelium Vitae Pope St John Paul II beautifully states that as the domestic church the family is summoned to proclaim celebrate and serve the Gospel of life In the family each new life is to be seen as a gift received from God for we are a people of reception Once we are able to truly see each life as a gift from God how we approach one another will forever be changed Faithfully in Christ Fr David WEEKEND OF JANUARY 2526 2020 CONFERENCE February 22 2020 Allen County War Memorial Coliseum Fort Wayne IN Tickets on sale NOW Flyers are available on the bulletin board ITS NEW YEAR Have you ever had that thought I want to get more involved in my Church but I am not sure how to go about it Or have you asked yourself I would like to become an Extraordinary Minister of Holy Communion but I dont know that I am worthy enough or a Lector who proclaims the word of God but Im not sure how to pronounce some of the nameswords in the readings we have Lector Workbooks to help with that I am afraid to mess up or I dont think I read well enough I once had those fears when I was approached about becoming an Extraordinary Minister of Holy Communion many years ago and a Priest said to me Are any of us worthy enough That has stuck with me through the years but even though we dont always feel worthy enough God is calling us He wants us involved whether it be a Lector Extraordinary Minister of Holy Communion a Minister of Hospitality join the Choir visit our homebound parishioners who are unable join us on the weekends help with funeral dinners join the Knights of Columbus or the St Joseph Womens Group become a Catechist give someone a ride to Mass This is a NEW YEAR a new chance to GET INVOLVED Is God calling YOU Talk with Fr David or call Michelle in the Parish office at 8243815 to learn how to get involved today CANDLEMAS DAY February 2 Forty days after Jesus birth Mary and Joseph brought him to the temple making an offering to the Lord We celebrate this on February 2nd also recalling the Holy Familys encounter with Simeon who declares Jesus will be a light to the nations Thus comes the tradition of blessing and presenting candles on that day Candlemas as it is known Bring your candles to be blessed at Mass Parttime sales associate Good Shepherd Books Gifts located in the Archbishop Noll Catholic Center in Fort Wayne is hiring a part time sales associate to work 416 hours each week For
